title: How to Tell If Your Cat Is in Heat

steps.title: Listen for calling.
steps.content: Listen for calling. Another term for being in heat is "calling." This is because the female becomes very vocal and will frequently walk around the house wailing or otherwise vocalizing. [2] X Research source Reproduction in the Dog & Cat. Christiansen. Publisher: Bailliere Tindall. This can sound like a plaintive, distressed cry, and can be loud and persistent enough to keep you awake at night. [3] X Research source Jean Johnson. Cat Expert. If your cat is naturally chatty all the time, vocalization is not necessarily a sign she is in heat. When a cat is "calling," her cries typically becomes much louder and more persistent, and occur alongside other behaviors noted below.

steps.title: Watch for restless behavior.
steps.content: Watch for restless behavior. Restless behavior and an inability to settle are characteristic of a female cat in heat. [4] X Research source Jean Johnson. Cat Expert. [5] X Research source Reproduction in the Dog & Cat. Christiansen. Publisher: Bailliere Tindall. This restlessness usually occurs at the same time as calling.

steps.title: Expect increased affection.
steps.content: Expect increased affection. A female cat in heat is often much more affectionate than she would typically be. [6] X Research source Jean Johnson. Cat Expert. If you cat is naturally stand-offish, this will usually change when she is in heat. [7] X Research source Reproduction in the Dog & Cat. Christiansen. Publisher: Bailliere Tindall. While in heat, your cat may rub around your ankles in such a persistent way that she becomes a trip hazard when you're trying to walk. This behavior will also manifest in the rubbing of her cheeks and chin (where her scent glands are located) against furniture, and especially entrance and exit points such as door frames. When in heat, a cat's scent changes subtly, and she enjoys spreading this around to advertise to that she'd like a mate to come visiting. [8] X Research source Reproduction in the Dog & Cat. Christiansen. Publisher: Bailliere Tindall.

steps.title: Pay attention to your cat's tail.
steps.content: Pay attention to your cat's tail. A typical sign of a cat ready to mate is the tail deflection reflex. This simply means that when you rub her lower back, especially over her pelvis and tail base, the female sticks her bottom in the air and moves her tail to one side. [9] X Research source Reproduction in the Dog & Cat. Christiansen. Publisher: Bailliere Tindall. This reflex is her way of making it easier for a male cat to gain access to her vulva to mate.

steps.title: Look for "commando crawling."
steps.content: Look for "commando crawling." This is a behavior in which the cat flattens her front quarters to the ground while sticking her bottom in the air, and then crawling along the floor in this posture. [10] X Research source Jean Johnson. Cat Expert. [11] X Research source Reproduction in the Dog & Cat. Christiansen. Publisher: Bailliere Tindall.

steps.title: Watch for rolling.
steps.content: Watch for rolling. Some female cats in heat will roll around on the ground and wail at the same time. [12] X Research source Reproduction in the Dog & Cat. Christiansen. Publisher: Bailliere Tindall. Understandably, if you don't know this behavior is entirely normal, it can appear alarming, and is a common cause of a panicked phone call to the on-call vet. However, this is not a sign that your cat is in pain.

steps.title: Watch for excessive licking.
steps.content: Watch for excessive licking. When a cat is in heat, it is typical for her vulva to become swollen. This mild swelling is uncomfortable, and will likely lead your cat to spend a lot of time washing the area. [13] X Research source Jean Johnson. Cat Expert. [14] X Research source Reproduction in the Dog & Cat. Christiansen. Publisher: Bailliere Tindall. This swelling is too slight for the casual observer to notice, so don't expect to see a physical difference. [15] X Research source Reproduction in the Dog & Cat. Christiansen. Publisher: Bailliere Tindall.

steps.title: Expect the cat to disappear.
steps.content: Expect the cat to disappear. Even home-loving cats get adventurous when in heat. If a male cat doesn't come calling, then she is likely to go wandering for a day or so to seek one out for herself. [16] X Research source Reproduction in the Dog & Cat. Christiansen. Publisher: Bailliere Tindall. If your cat is not spayed and you don't want her to get pregnant, keep her indoors during her heat and lock the cat flap so that intruders can't get in.

steps.title: Understand the estrus cycle.
steps.content: Understand the estrus cycle. Female cats are polyestrous, which means they go into heat many times a year. [17] X Research source Reproduction in the Dog & Cat. Christiansen. Publisher: Bailliere Tindall. This is in contrast to dogs, which experience a diestrus cycle, coming into heat only twice a year. [18] X Research source Reproduction in the Dog & Cat. Christiansen. Publisher: Bailliere Tindall. While in heat, your cat's womb will become swollen as its blood-supply increases in anticipation of a pregnancy. You will not be able to observe this, however, as there are no external signs of this process. [19] X Research source Reproduction in the Dog & Cat. Christiansen. Publisher: Bailliere Tindall.

steps.title: Understand the role of seasons.
steps.content: Understand the role of seasons. The breeding season of feral cats is between spring and late summer. This means kittens are born away from the harshest of the winter weather, when their chances of survival would be reduced. [20] X Research source Reproduction in the Dog & Cat. Christiansen. Publisher: Bailliere Tindall. Artificial light can fool a pet cat into thinking it is not winter. As such, if your cat spends much time indoors, the changing of seasons will have little or no effect on her reproductive cycle. [21] X Research source Reproduction in the Dog & Cat. Christiansen. Publisher: Bailliere Tindall. Expect a cat that lives indoors to come into heat all year around.

steps.title: Know the time frame.
steps.content: Know the time frame. The reproductive cycle of a female cat is, on average, 21 days. Of these three weeks, expect her to spend as many as seven days in heat. [22] X Research source Reproduction in the Dog & Cat. Christiansen. Publisher: Bailliere Tindall.
